title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't set context correctly for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard in Build 20011106, the context for nested classes is not set correctly. When the 'Enclosing Type' option is checked, the field is blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
OB: When I click the new class button while a .java file is open in the editor and check the 'Enclosing Type' option, the field where the current type should be displayed is blank.
EB: When I click the new class button while a .java file is open in the editor and check the 'Enclosing Type' option, the field should display the name of the current type in the editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue in Build 20011106, follow these steps:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click the new class button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' option.
4. Observe that the field where the current type should be displayed is blank.
